metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9725 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linuxkernel, during DMA allocation, due to wrong data type of size, allocationsize gets truncated which makes allocation succeed when it should fail.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-9725` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-generic-lpae - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-generic - 4.13.0-16.19
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-214-lowlatency - 4.13.0-16.19
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
linux-image-4.18.0-13-generic-lpae - 4.18.0-13.14~18.04.1
